intro: Amaracus pampaninii, commonly known as the Pampas amaracus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soils and full sunlight.
